['Adorn - to decorate or dress up something, typically with accessories.', 'Attire - clothing worn for a particular occasion or activity.', 'Dresser - an individual who prepares and presents attire elegantly.', 'Garment - an item of clothing.', 'Habiliment - a term used to describe clothes, especially as accessories that decorate the body.', 'Outfit - a set of clothes worn together, typically for a specific purpose or occasion.', 'Pep up - to make something more lively and attractive by adding clothing or adornments.', 'Suit (verb) - to dress in formal attire; the act of putting on formal wear.', 'Swag - a casual style that is fashionable, often associated with accessories that complement an outfit.', 'Wardrobe - the collection of clothes owned by someone.', 'Accessorize - to add extra items (accessories) like jewelry or hats to enhance an overall look.', 'Apparel - clothing, especially as a general term for all types of garments.', 'Costume - attire that represents a specific theme, character, or time period.', "Demeanor - the outward appearance and behavior often influenced by one's choice in dressing.", 'Elegance - having refined taste and style in clothing and accessories.', 'Ensemble - a coordinated set of clothes, often including both tops and bottoms or an entire outfit.', 'Fashion - the prevailing styles and trends in clothing and accessories.', "Garb - attire that defines someone's style or character, often used broadly for traditional clothing.", 'Glamour - a glittery, stylish appearance typically achieved with well-chosen clothes and accessories.', 'Styles (plural) - different ways of dressing; the various forms and types of clothing and adornments worn by people.']
